definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Ob 20 rampart, fortress (perh. orig. surrounding wall, cf. Sab. Denkm.:91 n. 2)—abs. [[חֵיל]] Na 3:8, [[חֵל]] La 2:8 + 3 t.;(+ Ps 10:10 Qr v. [[חלכה]]); cstr. [[חֵל]] 1Ki 21:23; sf. [[חֵילֵךְ]] Ps 122:7, [[חֵילָהּ]] Zec 9:4; [[חֵילָה]] = [[חֵילָהּ]] Ps 48:14, Ol:§ 40 c. 75g. 96 e Sta:§ 347 c;—

rampart (defined by Jews as [[בֶּן]] [[חוֹמָה]], i.e. a little wall, cf. Ki s. v.), of an outer fortification 2Sa 20:15 (others, by meton., of space between outer and inner fortif., incl. moat, v. Dr Kit); Is 26:1, La 2:8 (both ‖[[חוֹמוֹת]]); in gen. of defences, or sea-power of Tyre [[וְהִכָּה בַיׇּם חֵילָהּ]] Zec 9:4 (v. Sta:ZAW i.1881, 15), of No-Amon (Thebes) [[אֲשֶׁר חֵיל]] [[יׇם מִיׇּם חוֹמָתָהּ]] Na 3:8; of Zion Ps 122:7, also Ps 48:14 ([[חילה]] = [[חֵילָהּ]], cf. supr.; both ‖[[ארמנותיך]]).—For [[חֵל]] 1Ki 21:23 rd. prob. [[חֵלֶק]], q. v.
fortress [[גׇּלֻת הַחֵל הַזֶּה]] Ob:Ob 20 the exiles of this fortress (Hi-St; Or, AVRV this army, [[חֵל]] = [[חַיִל]]).
